data.description:
VRFS is a community-driven soccer (football) simulator with focus on realistic physics and competitive multiplayer.

Here are the main features of VRFS:

PHYSICS SIMULATION: Players can perform almost any trick, from balancing the ball on the tip of their foot to executing curved power shots and long passes. The ball's trajectory is solely determined by the physics engine.

COMPETITIVE MULTIPLAYER: The multiplayer architecture allows for instantaneous ball-touch response. For example, players can finish powerful crosses at the same speed as in real soccer. 

COMFORT: Players can move around using thumbsticks and play in either a seated or standing position. No intense hand movements are required.

NO PAY-TO-WIN in VRFS: Only skills matter. No one can buy 'stronger kicks' or 'faster boots.' Keep practicing, and you'll see improvement.

FREE FOR ALL: Players have full access to the game without needing to purchase anything. However, if you wish, you can buy cool equipment in the store to support the further development of this project.

Please keep in mind that VRFS is still in development, with upcoming upgrades to the physics and scenery. We'd appreciate your suggestions for any enhancements.

UPDATE 0.4.3 

[ Introducing the Camera Device ]
Record videos inside VRFS! Open the menu and tap the new icon at the top. Move around holding the device, fix it in the air, or even throw it around. We've optimized it to use minimal resources, but be aware that using the device on heavy custom arenas may cause FPS drops.

[ U19 Halloween Bundle ]
The Halloween bundle is available in the store until Halloween. It will be removed from the store afterward, but all purchased items are yours forever.

[ Dark Arena Template ]
A new dark scene is available in the arena builderâ€”perfect for creating scary places. We've also added a pumpkin object to the objects list.

[ New GK in Public Lobbies ]
The new goalie mechanics, which allow catching and throwing the ball, are now enabled in all public match lobbies. We also need your feedback on whether the gloves-dash feature should be removed.

[ Verification Badges ]
Based on initial feedback, weâ€™ve moved the badge to the username instead of the player model. The verified blue check mark will be visible in the player list in the lobby.

[ Bug Fixes and Enhancements ]
We've fixed many issues, including lag when switching jerseys and glove collision problems. Custom arenas have been significantly optimized, especially those with many blocks.

Available as an experimental feature in private matches for initial testing. Weâ€™ll improve body collisions based on your feedback.

Improved responsiveness and ball rotation during throws, along with several bug fixes. While we know youâ€™d like this feature in matches, it needs more polishing before being fully released.

A new bundle from U19 designers featuring 7 new gloves, including thin gloves similar to those used in sports like baseball and basketball.

CUSTOM ARENAS IN PUBLIC MATCH LOBBIES
We have selected 42 arenas that are a perfect fit for the game. More arenas will be added once the community voting is set. The respective authors will receive 'The Architect' bundle, which has a unique design. This bundle will also be sent to all authors whose arenas have gathered more than 500 ratings.

NEW U19 BUNDLES

ARENA EDITOR
Added new roofs and a windmill to the arena editor. We are also preparing cloud-based storage for items, allowing us to significantly increase objects and overall content (such as weather, more skies, and thousands of building objects).

BUGFIXES

UPDATE 0.3.7

**Multiplayer:**
- Updated multiplayer sync to decrease lag time and address issues like â€˜phasingâ€™. This should also help with the problem of deflected balls appearing as goals, but we are still working on more complex enhancements. This feature is experimental and we appreciate your feedback.
- You can now use gloves after the goal is scored (this was highly requested).

**Scenes:**
- Added an enlarged version of the starting stadium with access to the stands and locker rooms.

**Camera mode:**
- Press grip to speed up (two grips to speed up faster).
- Press triggers to go up/down.
- Use camera mode in online public practice lobbies and in arena editing.

**Arena editor:**
- Added snap to grid feature.
- Place texts with adjustable size and color (up to 1,000 chars per instance).
- Most of the objects now have a â€˜scaleâ€™ setting, thus allowing for resizing.
- Switch to camera mode when in the arena editor.

**Replays:**
- Share replay codes (and watch replays in the camera apps a bit later).
- Rewind / Fast-forward replays by pressing (A) and (X) on controllers.
- Slow-motion feature (press (A) + (X) on controllers).
- Increased smoothness of moving objects.

**Other:**
- Interface enhancements.
- Various fixes and optimizations in the in-game menu.
- Slightly improved sound effects.
- Some bugs were fixed 

**In-game store:**
- U19 Launch Bundle items removed from the store.
- New â€˜Fun Kitâ€™ bundle added, containing 12 items such as a golf ball, hockey puck, fitness ball, and more.

Announcement
Although the bundle is called 'Fun Kit,' its purpose goes beyond fun. It's part of our research, and the physics and features of these objects will evolve in the coming weeks.
